example: They decided to have an adventure and explore the uncharted mountain range.
Scientists conduct research at the North Pole to study climate change.
The well-known explorer led the expedition to the Arctic.
He set out to climb the highest mountain in his country.
The astronaut became an international celebrity after the successful space mission.
The new findings provide strong support for the theory of evolution.
They put together a team of experts for the research project.
The team was instructed to gather data from the remote region.
The committee will conduct a thorough investigation on the accident.
They found a shipwreck off the coast of Florida.
The expedition covered a distance of 500 miles across the desert.
They made a trek through the dense forest to reach the village.
She took photographs of the rare animals in their natural habitat.
New technology makes it possible to explore deep sea environments.
The map corresponds to the actual terrain surprisingly well.

chinese: 句型：这提供了证据表明...
example: This provides evidence that the ancient civilization had advanced farming techniques.

chinese: 句型：没有确凿的证据表明...
example: There's no solid evidence that the lost city ever existed.
The arguments presented in the report are not convincing to the committee.
It is true that the plan is ambitious, but it's not feasible with current resources.
The team is composed of scientists from various fields.

english: contribute a large sums of money to
example: The billionaire contributed a large sum of money to the environmental foundation.
The landscape here is similar to what you'd find in northern Canada.
Hikers must carry weighty backpacks during long expeditions.
Climbers often encounter unfavorable conditions on the mountain peak.
The success of the mission depends on gathering accurate data.
Scientists measure precisely the distance between the stars.

english: become faded and worn over time
chinese: 随时间变得褪色和磨损
example: Old maps often become faded and worn over time, making them hard to read.
The telescope can observe distant planets with great accuracy.
We are confident that the expedition will achieve its goals.
Experts question the authenticity of the ancient artifact's claim.
In general, expeditions require careful planning and preparation.
Some people refuse to believe the theory for ideological reasons.

chinese: 通过调查证明某人的主张
example: He proved his claim by investigating historical records.
New evidence casts doubt on the explorer's account of the journey.
They plan to explore the Arctic, to be specific, the waters around Greenland.
By contrast, the southern route is more dangerous but shorter.

english: contradict the idea and argue that（clause）
chinese: 反驳这个观点并认为（从句）
example: Scholars contradict the idea and argue that the civilization was more advanced.
They transported the equipment by air to reach the remote site quickly.
On the contrary, the evidence suggests the expedition was successful.

english: rebut the statement by pointing out that（clause）
chinese: 通过指出（从句）来反驳声明
example: She rebutted the statement by pointing out the flaws in the research.
The theory is based on years of scientific research.
They prepared all the equipment well in advance of the expedition.
The project is still at the planning stage.
The new intercity train service connects major cities efficiently.

english: There are a number of critics who believe that（clause）
chinese: 句型：有许多评论家认为（从句）
example: There are a number of critics who believe that the expedition was a hoax.
A privately owned company funded the archaeological expedition.
The scientist put forward a new theory about the ancient civilization.
The data strongly supports the researcher's position on climate change.

english: in remote and less populated areas
chinese: 在偏远且人口稀少的地区
example: They conducted research in remote and less populated areas of the Amazon.
The costs of the expedition add up to a significant amount.
The transport company decided to cut unprofitable routes to save costs.
The team will compete against other explorers in the race to the pole.
A large majority of the expedition members were experienced climbers.
Sled dogs were the primary means of transport in the Arctic expedition.
The foundation directs its funds at environmental conservation projects.
